text: Eudeilinia luteifera, the southern eudeilinea moth, is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Harrison Gray Dyar Jr. in 1917. It is found in the United States, where it has been recorded from Texas to Florida.Moth Photographers Group at Mississippi State University The wingspan is about 25 mm. Adults are white, the forewings with two curved irregular pale buff lines. The hindwings are similar, but the inner line is smaller.Dyar, Harrison G., 1917. Miscellaneous new America Lepidoptera. Insecutor Inscitiae Menstruus, 5(4-6): 68 Adults have been recorded on wing in March and from May to June in Florida. The larvae feed on Cornus florida.Bug Guide ==References== Category:Moths described in 1917 Category:Drepaninae
title: Eudeilinia luteifera
